title: Virtus robes

properties.name: description
properties.value: Virtus robes are a set of equipment requiring level 80 Magic and 75 Defence to equip. One of the proposed rewards from Nex, it was only available from the tournament supplies table in a tournament world as a test armour for players. It was later scrapped as a reward in favour of Torva armour, though the Old School Team has expressed interest in introducing it as a reward for a different piece of content in the future.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Virtus robes

Virtus robes are a set of equipment requiring level 80 Magic and 75 Defence to equip. One of the proposed rewards from Nex, it was only available from the tournament supplies table in a tournament world as a test armour for players. It was later scrapped as a reward in favour of Torva armour, though the Old School Team has expressed interest in introducing it as a reward for a different piece of content in the future.

Each piece of Virtus robes gives a 3% magic damage bonus towards Ancient Magicks spells, and wearing the full set grants buffs to each of the four spell types:

  • Smoke spells reduce the target's healing by 30% whilst poisoned.
  • Shadow spells lowers the target's Strength, Ranged, Magic, and Defence levels (in addition to Attack).
  • Blood spells can heal up to 20% over the user's base Hitpoints.
  • Ice spells have a 10% accuracy bonus towards an immobilised target.

Bonuses[edit | edit source]

Item Attack Bonuses Defence Bonuses Other
Virtus mask 0 0 0 +8 -3 +15 +14 +16 +6 0 0 0 0% +1
Virtus robe top 0 0 0 +35 -11 +47 +36 +56 +31 0 0 0 0% +2
Virtus robe bottoms 0 0 0 +26 -9 +31 +28 +34 +22 0 0 0 0% +1
Totals 0 0 0 +69 -23 +93 +78 +106 +59 0 0 0 0% +4

Historical[edit | edit source]

Virtus robes was one of the original rewards from Nex upon its release in RuneScape. Compared to Old School RuneScape's version of the set, the original set had several differences:

  • Having the robes equipped made all factions in the God Wars Dungeon unaggressive, rather than just Zarosian NPCs.
  • The robes did not have a magic damage bonus, nor did it have a passive effect.
  • The robes required level 80 Hitpoints in addition to Magic and Defence.
  • Each piece of the set boosted Hitpoints by a certain amount, equal to 40 Hitpoints:
    • Mask - 6.6 Hitpoints
    • Robe top - 20 Hitpoints
    • Robe legs - 13.4 Hitpoints
  • The robes degraded, lasting for 15 hours of combat. When fully degraded, the base repair costs were as follows:
    • Mask - 500,000 coins
    • Robe top - 2,000,000 coins
    • Robe legs - 1,000,000 coins
  • The robes had the following bonuses:
Item Attack Bonuses Defence Bonuses Other
Virtus mask 0 0 0 +9 -3 +20 +18 +20 +9 -1 0 0 0% +1
Virtus robe top 0 0 0 +36 -11 +63 +50 +70 +36 0 0 0 0% +1
Virtus robe bottoms 0 0 0 +26 -8 +38 +40 +40 +26 0 0 0 0% +1
Totals 0 0 0 +71 -22 +121 +108 +130 +71 -1 0 0 0% +3
